quotes.text: This new year, wish for the strength to be centred when faced with challenges and the willingness to serve. Remind yourself again and again that happiness is your nature. (Note: use a really nice pic)
Faith is like a mountain and doubts are like clouds. Can a cloud ever shake a mountain? It is impossible.
Usually in life, you give up in anger; If you learn to give up in wisdom , you will never get frustrated!
Spirituality helps you achieve goals in material life. If you find success, it keeps you centred. If not, it gives you strength to move on.
If you have the strength to accept criticism, then nothing can throw you off balance.
Craving happens for small or temporary things - food, fame, sex. Longing is always for the higher & permanent - Love!
There is strength in peace, there is strength in calmness, there is strength in love. What you cannot win with guns, you can win with love.
Passion when you work, dispassion when you turn inward and compassion at all times, is the key to a fulfilled life.
Pleasure keeps you on the run; first towards the object & then away from it. Yoga & dispassion keep you centered.
It is common to get angry at someone else’s mistakes. It needs a big heart to feel compassion and accommodate their wrong doings and to give them a chance to change.
Change is constant. But change is recognized by something that is constant! Focus on that unchanging aspect in you. That is the game-changer!
Seeing life from a bigger Context - Committing to a bigger cause - Compassion in life.
Like the waves in the ocean, storms are inevitable in life. No storm lasts forever and no storm can affect the depth of the ocean. Even when the storms come, you are like the ocean, deep as ever.
See what is temporary and what is permanent. All the opinions of people are temporary. They come and go. This you must remember.
Stop blaming yourself - this is the first law of spirituality. The more you blame, the more you will be away from your own spirit.
Take some time off to go within, in silence. With that, your charm becomes eternal, your love becomes unconditional & great strength arises.
There is a natural tendency in each soul to look for a joy that does not diminish; a love that does not distort. This is possible with meditation.
Freedom means having a say over your inner tendencies and external influences. Only awareness and impeccable devotion can bring this freedom.
Let your smile change the world! Never let the world change your smile!
Usually, we hurry the mind but are slow in action. The right formula for success is patience in the mind and dynamism in action.
Combine inner peace with faith & you have a formula to face any situation. Realise that you are blessed, then all insecurities disappear.
People with contentment usually do not act. It is easy to act out of frustration. The real skill is to be content and still act.

On Makar Sankranti, we exchange sesame seeds & jaggery. The tiny sesame seeds remind us of our insignificance in this vast creation. The feeling that ‘I am nothing’ dissolves the ego & brings humility. Jaggery is a symbol of spreading sweetness.
When someone blames you, they take away some negative karma from you. If you understand this, you will only feel happy about it.
The strength of a relationship lies in its ability to accommodate rough patches. You must exhibit your character instead of trying to change the other.
Friendship based just on needs does not last long. However, when it comes from a space of sharing, the whole world will befriend you.
A person of true courage and passion is one who responds to any criticism with an unshakeable smile.
The more service you do, the more merit you acquire in life. The more the merit, the more peaceful & serene you become from within.
If your relationship with your Self is profound & steady, you naturally develop the skills to handle any kind of relationship.
Feverishness for fame, pride & social recognition is immaturity. Just wake up & see there is nothing much in it. It is an empty bowl.
Our lives will take a new direction if we take pride in nonviolence, compassion & service. That should be our unwavering commitment.
Your attention has tremendous energy. If you put it only on the lack, then lack will continue to dominate your life.
Passion for transformation and dispassion for momentary pleasures can make you a profound and strong person.
If you don't crave for joy, misery won't touch you. If you don’t crave for peace, nothing will disturb you. Use every situation for inner growth.
Being happy when everything is going well is no achievement. In the midst of adversity and things go wrong, if you can still smile, then you have achieved something very valuable.

Worry is either about acquiring what is out of reach or holding on to what is already acquired. When you know that it is the Divine who brings you what is out of reach & protects what you have, you are free from worry.
Why am I here?’ Wake up, ask this question, and pursue it to get an answer. No books will answer this question because this is the question of ‘life’. Your life itself is an answer.
The knots in the heart unravel, doubts in the mind disappear, karmas dissolve with just a glimpse of the Beloved; the Divine.
Dispassion increases enthusiasm. It may sound strange but it's true. Enthusiasm is your nature & dispassion is the way to realise this.
God is not an object of the senses but the feeling of feelings,sound of silence,the light of life,the essence of the world & the taste of bliss.

Opposition in life is like a shadow. There's no shadow when you're lying on the ground. It appears the moment you stand up. When you're with the light, the shadow is behind you. If you are fighting shadows, you've turned away from the light. Wake up & walk; your path is already lit!
Just know that you have the capability to face any challenge that life throws at you.
Negative thoughts are like shadows. As you turn towards the light of knowledge, they disappear.
If you are a taker of happiness, you get misery. If you are a giver of happiness, you get joy and love.

Sleep is nature compelling you to go into silence unconsciously. It gives you energy. When you choose to be silent consciously, that is meditation. It gives you more energy and can help open doors to subtle dimensions.
Events give rise to both emotions & lessons. Often we hold onto emotions & don't learn. Wisdom is to drop emotions & move on with lessons.
It is not people who hurt you but your own mind, vulnerability and your own emotions that entangle you & make you feel hurt.
If you want to make progress in life or on the spiritual path, you must avoid procrastination, laziness, self-blame and blaming others.
Invoke the valour in you. Just say,’ Okay, whatever comes, I am going to take it as a challenge.’ When you invoke this energy, fear vanishes.
Love for the Divine & love for the country are not different. If we are strong from within, we can work better for the nation.
Defending your mistake is a sign of weakness. Accepting your mistakes and moving on shows your strength.
Excessive ambition or greed makes one weak and fearful. Turn your attention on yourself and realise that you are the strength you search for.
Breathing & meditation uplifts the spirit, brings clarity to our mind, and gives mental strength.
Spirituality is that which gives you strength and stability, a vision & a mission in life.
Always remember that the world is eager to give you back more than what you give the world.
Keep the mind happy and peaceful and keep working too. Balancing work and rest is the sign of intelligence.
Just wake up and see that the entire past is only a memory.  All events are dissolving In the flow of time,.
Don't waste today for what happened yesterday. Wake up and say, 'I have the valour and the courage to overcome this.'
There is no growth in doing what you can do. Stretching a little beyond your capacity makes you grow.
It is easy to disparage someone. It takes courage and intelligence to uplift people and bring out their divine qualities.
Faith and prayerfulness in tough times & service and humility in good times are the ways of the wise.
Take every problem as a challenge! Then there is no power in this world that can wipe the smile off your face.
Humour is the buffer that saves you from humiliation. If you have a good sense of humour you can never be humiliated.
One thing you must know is that life moves in the direction of the best. On the way you may find rough roads, but they take you towards the better.
Every moment you spend on this planet, remember that you are here for a unique purpose & cause; far greater than just to eat, sleep & talk.
When you know what you can do, you can progress. But when you don’t know what you can do and you have confidence, then you can grow by leaps and bounds. Ignorance of your capability can expand you!
Your faith in someone is your own virtue, not a favour to them.
A narrow and petty mind picks up a small mistake and harps on it while a broad mind finds the smallest virtue and glorifies it.

When we take on a monumental task; some people support, some step aside, some oppose and many just stand and watch. This is all part of the process. When the intentions are pure and the goal is for the good of all, we should keep moving forward.
Whatever is yours will always be yours. Anything that goes away was never yours to begin with. If you know this, you will be at peace.
Spiritual practices are not necessarily serious & difficult. If you follow wisdom, fun follows you. If you follow fun, misery follows you.
When someone admits a mistake, they should be appreciated for their honesty and not be frowned upon.
When you're in the grip of feverishness - dispassion, meditation, breathing, and listening to flute music can help calm you down.
The source of joy is deep within & events are impermanent. Keeping the mind like a clean mirror & being unfazed by events is Yoga.
See the Divine in your Valentine and make the Divinity your Valentine. Just BE and know that you are LOVED. That is BELOVED!
The real purpose of life can only be found deep within yourself. Once that is found, nothing else matters and the smile on your face will never diminish.
When you meditate, let the world be as it is. The repetition of meditation is to habituate our system to stop & start activity at will.
When you are happy, time appears shorter. When you are sad, time appears longer. And in meditation we transcend time!
Body stretched is Dance. Sound stretched is Music. Mind stretched is Meditation. Love stretched is Service.
Who is Shiva? The wise have always responded to this question with a counter question - Who is not Shiva? Shiva is both the material cause & the cause of all causes in the existence.

Like the waves in the ocean, storms are inevitable in life. No storm lasts forever and no storm can affect the depth of the ocean. Accept all that comes with open arms. Even when the storms come, you are like the ocean, deep as ever.

Often people take their commitment for granted, and then the mind starts complaining. Like the fuel in the car, your dedication and commitment runs out in the course of time. It needs constant renewal. You have to dedicate and rededicate again and again.
When the mind is centered, free from fear, guilt & anger, then it has the power to heal any ailment.
Know that you are born in this world to do something wonderful & unique. Give yourself the freedom to dream & think big.
When the heart speaks & heart listens, harmony is produced. When head talks & head listens, arguments are produced.

Simplicity & skilfulness seem opposite but they are not. Being simple is not naivety & being skilful is not cunningness. You need skill to excel in the world outside & you need to be simple & innocent to be able to go deep within yourself. Both are essential in life.
The relationship with the Guru is beyond action, speech & feelings. It's a connection of the very being. When you know this, you become calm & confident.
Astrological predictions are like weather forecast.There is always a probability factor.The remedy for malefic effects is devotion & service.
Knowing that the past is destiny, the future is free will, you should live happily in the present moment. This is wisdom.
A strong body can carry a weak mind, but a weak mind cannot carry even a strong body.

Know it for sure that the entire universe loves you very dearly. This wisdom can elevate you to a different level altogether, at which you no longer come from a space of lack or demand for a relationship.

The river never gets tired of flowing, the air does not get tired of flowing, the Sun does not get tired of shining. When we get established in our true nature, then everything simply happens and does not tire us out.
Anger and aggression are not signs of heroism. They are signs of weakness.
Being free is like being a kid again. A baby is free but it is weak but an enlightened one is free and strong. A baby is free with dependence; enlightenment is freedom with utter independence.
Know that life goes on with commitment, not moods. Moods are very unstable, they come and change. But commitment and wisdom always bring the best results.
Shiva is Beauty, yet He is Unseen. Shiva is Benevolent, yet He is Fierce. Shiva is Truth, and everything lies in Him. Shiva is Satyam, Shivam, Sundaram.
Cleanliness and happiness are both practices. If something is dirty, we don’t say it will clean itself up. We have to make an effort to clean it. Similarly, we have to practice being happy.
What determines whether a society is strong and harmonious, or otherwise, is the role of women in it.
Being happy when everything is going well is no achievement. When things go wrong, in the midst of adversity, if you can smile, then you have achieved something very valuable.
Uncertainty often leads you to worry & tension. But in a heightened state of consciousness, the same uncertainty is thrilling and fun.

People who have depth often appear serious and people who are light often seem flaky. A childlike simplicity along with the depth of a thousand-year-old, meaning fun with wisdom, is a rare combination.
Often we find in the word that the sensible and the inteligent are shy, while the stupid are shameless.  It should be the other way around.
When you make service the purpose of your Life, it eliminates fear, brings focus in the mind & gives long-term joy.
The youth need to imbibe sincerity in purpose, honesty in approach & dexterity in action to become good leaders.
Loyalty is needed both in the spiritual and material plane. It takes you beyond the duality of craving & aversion. Responsibility, dedication & commitment are the limbs of loyalty.
Nature is full of colours and different colours are associated with our feelings and emotions. Be centered so that you can enjoy all the colours regardless of the events. Happy Holi!
Happiness is not just in partying & socialising. It is the space of calmness &; serenity within oneself. This International Happiness Day, hope you find it in being quiet.
The busier you are in life, the more important it is to meditate. Meditation is getting back to that serenity which is your true nature.
When you have a pure heart and clear intention, nothing can deter you & nature will support you.
A quiet serene smile can convey what a thousand words cannot. Keep smiling and keep serving.
Everything you do in your life directs you towards one thing - finding Inner Happiness.
Through meditation, find happiness within. Through service, spread happiness outside.
When you are content and not bombarded with your own needs, you gain the ability to bless.
When you consider the past as free will, then you have regret. When you consider the future as destiny, you will do nothing about it. Wisdom is seeing the past as destiny and future as free will.
We convey more through our presence, through our vibrations than through our words.
When you see events as just 'happenings', rather than as 'doings', you are liberated right away.
All of one’s life is spent in preparing to be happy someday in the future. It’s like making a bed all night, but having no time to sleep.
Life is 80% joy and 20% misery. But we hold on to the 20% misery and make it 200%!

Why do your spirits go down? Usually it is because somebody said something stupid to you. And why? Because they had some garbage and they needed to throw it out. And you were there, ready to catch it.

Nobody can feel good or bad all the time. Just as waves come and go, clouds come and go, emotions also come and go. You can’t stop a wave that has already arisen; nor can you make a wave rise just like that.
Life runs on commitment. The larger the commitment, bigger is the power you gain to fulfil that commitment!
One technique to get depressed is to sit and think only about yourself-'what about me, what will happen to me?'
Don’t judge and worry about what others think of you. Whatever they think, it's not permanent. Your own opinion about things and people keeps changing all the time!
Knowing that the past is destiny, the future is free will, you should live happily in the present moment. This is wisdom.

This New Year, make a resolution to forgive all those you are/were upset with or angry at in the past year, and start a new chapter with enthusiasm and naturalness. Resolve to do something excellent and to be of use to others. Be happy and spread happiness.
Leadership is more about taking the team ahead, rather than putting oneself in the front. The best leader is like a shepherd who stands behind and moves the flock forward.

Everybody has the right to be imperfect. Rather than expecting perfection in people, situations or yourself, change your perception. The mere recognition that this is how the world is, brings acceptance and you become centered and calm.

Success of any endeavor depends on the action and the strength of action depends on the power of intention behind it. The intention gains strength when one drops the feverishness for the result of the action. So, give your 100% and let go.
Every living creature wants to be happy. Whether it is money, power or sex, you get into it for the sake of happiness. Some people even enjoy misery because it gives them happiness!
How many minutes, hours and days have you spent in your lives being happy from within? Those are the only moments you have really lived life.
Hurt is a part of love. When you are in love, you are in such a delicate space, that a simple action – even an act of non-deliberate ignoring hurts you - an act of indifference hurts you.
Excessive ambition or greed makes one weak and fearful. Turn your attention on yourself and realise you are the strength you search for.
Breathing & meditation uplifts the spirit, brings clarity to our mind, and gives mental strength.
Worldly love can be like an ocean, yet an ocean has a bottom. Divine love is like the sky which is limitless. From the bottom of the ocean, soar into the vast sky.
When personal needs disappear and desires no longer exist; an extraordinary, mystical ability is awakened within us that enables us to bless others.
There is some element within us which is unchanging and undying. If the slightest attention is directed to it, life becomes easy and uncomplicated.
When you examine your life, that observing of life is Spirituality; it is Satsang. Satsang is not just singing bhajans, but pondering over the Truths of Life.

We all have certain needs and certain responsibilities. If your needs are more than your responsibilities, there will be unhappiness in life. If our responsibilities are more than our needs, life will be peaceful.
Life poses many challenges. The way of the wise is to accept situations and move through them with a smile.
In devotion, one can experience total freedom from fear and worry. A devotee transcends worldly sorrows and pains.
The knowledge of how to deal with negative emotions, how to keep mentally and emotionally healthy is essential for everyone to keep society healthy.
Logic depends on knowledge & since your knowledge is limited, your logic is also limited. If you can recognize this, you can take a leap into the unknown, otherwise you are stuck in a whirlpool.
Enthusiasm is a wealth that everyone has in abundance in childhood but declines with age. Being mature need not mean being dry. Real knowledge is that which protects your enthusiasm as you mature.
Violence is neither our true nature nor the basis of civilization. Let us reinstil pride in being peaceful & compassionate in the youth.
If authority is not in the right perspective, right dosage & right hands, it can stifle creativity & progress.
Legendary is the commitment that withstands humiliation. It will be one-pointed & reach the goal.
Change is constant. But change is recognized by something that is constant! Focus on the unchanging aspect in you. That is the game-changer!
The mind has a tendency to doubt the positive things in life. Doubt the negative and put your trust in the positive.
Do not let adverse situations leave impressions in your mind and take your happiness away. Shrug them off and stand tall.

Worry is either about acquiring what is out of reach or holding on to what is already acquired. When you know that it is the Divine who brings you what is out of reach &; protects what you have, you are free from worry.
When the light of knowledge and devotion shines bright, there is no darkness anymore.

You identify with what makes you different from others-name, appearance, individuality & so on. When you become aware of a space within, where these attributes don't exist & identify with That space, you come to know who you really are.
Sacrifice makes life worth living. It brings out your magnanimity and helps you move out of misery. Sacrifice makes you sacred.
You pray for that which you cannot achieve with your efforts, skills & abilities.
A happy face is the real indicator of health. Let us not forget total health includes mental health, emotional well-being and civilized behaviour.
Motherhood is wanting the best for others and not expecting anything in return.  There is motherhood in each and every one of us.
When you walk the talk, you command respect and faith. Else, you end up demanding them and still don’t get any.
Conflict is present in all aspects of life. When one has acceptance and the right intention, then any conflict can be resolved peacefully.
Desire to be liked by others leads you to disappointment. Be grounded in yourself and do the best you can do for others.
There is nothing wrong with anger if it is under your control. When anger controls you, it is a recipe for disaster.
When you have a Guru, you can be sure of success in life without any fear.
Life should be a balance of listening to our heart and the mind.
When you have a deep experience within, you naturally tend to share it with others. The nature of joy is to share.
Wisdom from past experiences, spiritual practices, valour & faith will help you sail through the rough patches of life.
Surrender doesn’t mean the absence of action. Be active; be dynamic, but not obsessed with the feverishness about fulfilling the desires.
It is only through inner silence that you can bring out happiness and celebration in life.
You can't thank me with a card. I won't accept it. What you need to do is to bring joy in a few people around you. That's the real, authentic way of thanking me.
If you have received love, you give love.
Make others comfortable and you will see that nature will take care of your comfort.
To create peace around, you have to first find peace within.
Life is a combination of effort and effortlessness; deep rest and dynamic activity; passion and dispassion.
The sense of loneliness exists because we haven't learnt how to be at peace with ourselves. If we do,we will be a source of joy for everyone around us!
Just Be! True joy is going beyond your identity. Real rest is going beyond your desires. Mature love is feeling the oneness. Relax & just be! Events are transitory. Pickup the wisdom and be free!
Unconditional love exists within every being and life is all about expressing it.
The mind has a tendency to doubt the positive. To understand trust, one needs to know what doubt is.

Often people think they are sad because of love. It is not so. It is craving for attention from the other or aversion to the other's behaviour that causes sadness. Love really begins when you go beyond craving & aversion.
Can you consciously cut off from everything around you for a few minutes? If you could, that will lead you to meditation & it gives you access to enormous energy within.
Often, one cuts communication when one is unhappy. Keeping communication alive in adverse situations and with those with whom you disagree can help rekindle happiness.
Usually, we hurry the mind but are slow in our action. The right formula for success is patience in the mind and dynamism in action.
If you have the strength to accept criticism, then nothing can throw you off balance. One who can respond to any criticism with an unshakeable smile has true courage and passion

It's not only your shortcomings that cause you grief. Your abilities, when not recognized, also bring you grief. You will be happier if you practice detachment, both from your shortcomings & abilities.
Uncertainty often leads you to worry & tension. But in a heightened state of consciousness, the same uncertainty is thrill and fun.
Be like water. It rises above the stones & flows. Similarly, rise above the obstacles in life & move through them with patience.
If wisdom cannot remove your misery and bring happiness, nothing else can.
Have a big vision! The bigger our vision for the world, the lesser will be our personal worries!
Weigh your words. They are the pearls of your life. Don't throw them awat. Don't lose them for nothing.
Take every problem as a challenge! Then there is no power in this world that can wipe the smile off your face.
A sincere and heartfelt cry will never go unanswered.

Yoga is not just a set of stretches but an attitude - how you care for Nature, how you connect with people, of all races, cultures & religions. That oneness with Divinity, with Nature & people is the real essence of Yoga!
It is faith that uplifts the mind from the mundane to the ethereal. Faith gives strength to those in distress and depth to those in joy.
Some things are obtained through struggle and some through patience. You need both qualities in life. Discrimination is knowing when to fight and when to be patient.
If you manipulate words it’s a lie, if you play with words it’s a joke, if you rely on words it’s ignorance, if you transcend words it’s wisdom.
Do not let adverse situations leave impressions in your mind and take your happiness away. Shrug them off and stand tall.
When individuals become peaceful, communities become peaceful. When world leaders have a broad vision, world peace is a possibility.
The concept that things should be a certain way causes pain in the mind. The cause of distress is set concepts in the mind.
The mind has a tendency to doubt the positive things in life. Doubt the negative and put your trust in the positive.
Passion when you work, dispassion when you turn inward and compassion at all times, is the key to a fulfilling life.
When someone blames you, they take away some negative karma from you. If you understand this, you will only feel happy about it.
Go through life with dedication & commitment. Your life is dedicated to a cause on this planet. This brings valour, vigour, peace & stability.
Emotions are something you are born with. You just need to have a say over them. When emotions dominate, they cause disasters. When intellect dominates, it is able to harness the emotions.
In your pursuit of happiness, look into all the pleasures that you get from the world. They all come with a tax, & this tax is sorrow.
With all its infinite possibilities, this life is a gift as it can become a fountain of joy not just for oneself but for others as well.
Work doesn't tire you as much as your desires & attachments. A yogi works 100%, without desires or attachments. This is karma yoga.
One has to learn to turn the senses inward. The mind turns inward when it is fed up of the world or content in life, .
Dispassion is the strength in you.It helps you understand that everyone has come to give something and we have nothing to take from this world.
Insecurity makes one defensive & this tendency to be defensive blocks one from blossoming.
Friendship based just on needs doesn't last long. However, when it comes from a space of sharing, the whole world will befriend you.
Trying times bring the best out of you. Rewarding times give the best of the world to you. Life is a combination of both. Move on with zeal.
Freedom is when life becomes a play, cravings & aversions dissolve & belongingness flowers.
Your faith & love are a 100 times more powerful than doubt. Faith is like the sun, doubt is like a cloud. Despite cloudy days, the sun shines!

A moment of gratefulness can bring a huge transformation in one's life. Gurupurnima is the day to remember all that you have been bestowed with, to rekindle that gratitude, soar to greater heights and reach your goal.
When you make service the purpose of your life, it eliminates fear, brings focus & gives long-term joy.
Peace is a positive phenomenon inside us. If people can access inner peace then outer peace becomes a reality. This is the key to world peace.

You have no control over what thought comes as you know it only after it has come; Although you have a choice which one to act upon. You can only pray to the cosmos to gift you noble thoughts. The Gayatri Mantra is a prayer for that.
Feel grateful for your very existence & all that you have received. This will bring a flood of prosperity & happiness.
There is nothing wrong in aspiring for materialistic growth as long as you don't ignore sincerity, integrity and compassion.
Often one fails to recognise one's flaws in the garb of honesty, authenticity, and righteousness.
Moving through challenges with a smile, sharing happiness with others, feeling one with everyone - this is the Art of Living.
When you find true happiness, you can't but share it with others. It doesn't need any other motivation.
Holding on to commitment gives a direction to life. If you let go of your commitment, you cannot be successful.
One doesn't need to be great in order to be respected. Respecting life itself makes you great.
The visible sign of inner peace is an undying smile. Share your smile. The world needs it.
‘Manaha’ is the mind and the its reverse ‘Namaha’ is the mind moving inwards. ‘Vashi’ means control and the opposite of it - Shiva - is complete letting go.
Anger is the punishment one gives oneself for someone else’s mistake. Save your mind at all costs.

People who are chaotic in nature find discipline stifling. For those who are very disciplined, chaos is irritating & unsettling. If you can be at home in both - chaos & discipline - you have won the game of life.
Peace is not something that can be bought from the marketplace or achieved solely by high-level policies. It has to be nurtured within.
Desires are like horses. As long as you are in control, it's fine. But desires shouldn't ride you. Keep the leash of your desires in your hands.
The more power you give away or designate, the more it comes back to you. The less you try to control things, the more they work out for you.
If your faith remains unshaken despite a hundred events that Nature throws to you, then you are a perfected person and life becomes smooth.
Life is a blend of sensitivity & sensibility. Sensibility is of the intellect, sensitivity is of the heart. You need to be sensitive yet strong.
An uncommitted mind is miserable. A committed mind may at times experience rough weather but it will reap the fruits of its toil.
All the talents that you possess are for the benefit of others. Put them to good use.
One thing you must know is that life moves in the direction of the best. On the way you may find rough roads, but it is towards the better.
Events give rise to both emotions & lessons. Often we hold onto emotions & don't learn. Wisdom is to drop emotions & move on with lessons.
Don't equate good fortune with money. Your good fortune lies in your happiness.
To be enthusiastic in favorable conditions is normal but maintaining enthusiasm in adverse situations indicates maturity & wisdom.
Enthusiasm is a wealth that everyone has in abundance in childhood but declines with age. Real knowledge is that which protects your enthusiasm as you mature.
When there is bonding, there is no fear. Raksha Bandhan is a festival of giving assurance and confidence to each other that, “I am there with you!” With this assurance, fear vanishes.
Have a clear goal and work for it without feverishness. If you apply yourself sincerely and have the patience to hold on, you will find support from nature.
Emotions are such that they can take over your sense of reasoning. When you recognise this, you are already one step out of it and that’s when you really rejoice even in a conflict.

Demanding authority indicates lack of confidence & belongingness. The more evident one’s authority is, the less sensitive & effective it will be. The subtler you become, the more authority you gain. A wise person will not demand authority but will simply assume it.
It is foolish to be perturbed by foolishness. It cannot overpower or annihilate wisdom. When you create a little space for stupidity you do not get perturbed by it, rather you will laugh and move on!
The purpose of life is to celebrate and to bring celebration to others. When you’re full with wisdom, you only bring light and love to the world.
When you realize your life and the whole world is just a 'leela',a play, then a Krishna is born inside you!
Krishna embodies the ultimate human blossoming-the perfect balance of the ethereal & earthly life; the humane & the Divine. Happy Janmashtami!
Humour is the buffer that saves you from humiliation. If you have a good sense of humour you can never be humiliated. And if you refuse to be humiliated you become invincible.
Be satisfied when it comes to your personal needs and never be satisfied when it concerns common good.
Whenever you are unhappy or miserable, know for sure you need food for the soul. And that is meditation.
When you are unhappy, you are coming in touch with your own boundaries. Turn the situation into a prayer & you will walk through it.
Have faith in the laws of Nature. Have faith in the goodness of people. Have faith in yourself.
Put your friends & enemies in one basket & relax. Be content & happy with yourself.
Every now & then,take some time off for your own space & get into the cave of your heart. Then you won't feel lonely,even when you are alone.
Weigh your words. They are the pearls of your Life. Don't throw them away or lose them for anything.
Sadness is a warning that you have gone away from the Self. Go back to the Self which radiates happiness.

Be non-violent, not just in your actions, but also in your heart, in your speech, in your thoughts. Keep the purity of your mind, speech, and body.

When your heart is filled with love, and compassion, you are so powerful! Never underestimate yourself.

Do your job sincerely and attend to all your duties and responsibilities wholeheartedly. Leave the rest to God with faith.

You pray when you feel grateful or when you feel utterly helpless. In either case, your prayers will be heard and answered.
Learn to take ups and downs in your stride. When faced with difficult times, invoke the valour in you and tackle the situation with confidence.

The way to make relationships long-lasting is through the right perception, the right observation, and the right expression.
Life is a lesson of just three things – perception, observation, and expression. Every mistake you make is really not a mistake; it is a learning process of the three vital aspects of life.
Shiva is the one from which everything has come, everything is sustained and everything is dissolved.

Lord Shiva is seated deep in everyone's heart. He is Nirguna (one who is without form or its attributes.) He is Nirakaar (one who has no shape or form.) And he is Parabrahma (supreme transcendental consciousness.) Believe in this.
Shiva is beauty, yet he is unseen. Shiva is benevolent, yet he is fierce. Shiva is Truth and everything lies in him. Shiva is Satyam, Shivam, Sundaram.

Shiva is a principle, it is the 'ShivaTattva.' Shiva wasn't a person. Never ever limit Shiva to a body, space or time. That's why he is called 'Mahakaal,' the time of all times, the cause of all causes.

Celebrating the Shiva Tattva in oneself is called Shivratri. Shiva is transcendental, divine consciousness that brings solace to all levels of existence. Like sponge in water, when mind and body are in Shiva Tattva, wishes get fulfilled effortlessly.

Handle competition playfully; stress only leads to loss, both in competition and in life.

The blessings of an individual who is content, will manifest. This is the secret behind blessing.
In the lap of the night, all beings sleep and find freedom from fear & sorrow, although for a short time. The wise awaken to the Shiva Principle, and are liberated forever. Happy Mahashivratri!

Not everything in this world is hunky-dory. However, if you are grounded in faith, then you will progress and maintain your equanimity in this world.
A true prayer can’t happen without devotion and faith. Having faith is to realise that God is there to protect you.

Latching on to the non-changing aspect of ourselves will help you sail through all the rough patches and make life a celebration.

Don't defend your mistakes. Just accept them and move on. When you are totally defenseless, that's when you'll be strong.

A world without violence is a dream worth making every effort for.

Health is having all these – a disease-free body; a quiver-free breath; a stress-free mind; an inhibition-free intellect; an obsession-free memory; an ego that includes all, and a soul that is free from sorrow.

Intelligent people witness, while the foolish get sucked into emotions and react.
See the impermanence of all things, everything around you. The whole world is changing. Then also you gain strength and fear disappears.
When you feel the obstacle is too much to handle, deep prayer can work miracles.
When passing through difficult times, we need to renew our faith. During such a time, invoke the valor in you and tackle the challenge with confidence.

While you sit for meditation you have to let the world be the way it is. The repetition of meditation is to habituate your system to stop and start activity at will. The ability to consciously do this is a precious skill.
The sankalpa (intention) of a weak mind is ineffective. We can make our mind strong by sadhana (spiritual practices) and knowledge. Then the sankalpa will also be strong.
The right way of asking is, first, having that confidence in the divine and knowing that “I have this request and it will be granted to me.” One should apply effort, work and also relax.
Nothing gets done without drive and passion. Too much of it creates feverishness and spoils the work. So you need measured passion and dispassion.
Knowledge has the power to push you through any tough situation. Without this wisdom, even in the best of situations you will grumble and be discontent. The switch is within you.

You go crazy over little insignificant things and that worries you over and over again, day and night for several years. Once you are surrendered, there comes a depth in you and nothing whatsoever can throw you off.

If you try to build a relationship that is when you become a little artificial. Best is to be yourself, to be natural, to be forgiving and to be in the present moment. It makes a big difference.

You should not ask for proof of the Divine’s love for you. Always know that the Divine loves you.

When desires arise, instead of holding on to them or daydreaming, just surrender. Surrender simply means that when a desire arises, offer it to the divine or a higher power and say: 'If it is good for me, let it happen.'
Do not think that dispassion is a state of apathy. Dispassion is full of enthusiasm — it brings all joy to your life and allows you to rest so well.

When you know that everything is changing — all relationships, people, body, feelings — suddenly the mind, which clings on to misery, comes back to you. The return from 'mine' to 'me', gives you contentment and freedom from misery.

Having aversion towards something or someone and avoiding them is a sign of an ignorant person. It is not the quality of a true Seeker. A true Seeker is happy at all times.
